page.title: 15RECREATION BREAK DANCING
page.content: {Break dancing}is a modern form of dancing. The moves can be spinning on parts of the body, such as the hand, back or head, more difficult moves such as spinning on your shoulders with your legs apart, called a windmill, and other moves such as the pinwheel. This is done with one leg stretched out and the other one bent. You put your hands on the floor in front of your body, move the straight leg round (forwards) and when it gets to your other leg, you jump. You repeat this process until you want to stop. Scramble is somewhat like a pinwheel but both legs go round and you make a kind of twist half way through. You use your hands to push yourself round. We practise at the {Youth Club}and won a competition at Poole Quay. We call ourselves "street names" e g Micro Turbo Machine and TJ.
